title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 375-6.3 - Unrestricted use soil cleanup objectives
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 375-6.3 - Unrestricted use soil cleanup objectives

State Regulations
(a) Applicability. The unrestricted use soil
cleanup objectives represent the concentration of a contaminant in soil which, when achieved at a site, will require no use restrictions on the site for the
protection of public health, groundwater and ecological resources due to the
presence of contaminants in the soil. (b) Soil cleanup objectives. (1)

The calculated values for the protection
of groundwater, ecological resources and public health were considered in
developing the unrestricted use soil cleanup objectives. The unrestricted soil
cleanup objectives in Table 375- 6.8(a) of this Subpart represent the lowest of
the three values for protection of groundwater, ecological resources and public
health developed as set forth in ECL 27-1415(6). (2)

Unrestricted use, as set forth in section
375-1.8
(g)(1)(i)
of this Part, is achieved when a remedial program for soil meets the
unrestricted use soil cleanup objectives in Table 375-6.8(a) of this

Subpart. Notes
